intro: Guardiola mexicana var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf guardiola, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and often aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while the flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The species is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles.
